metadata.synopsis: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.

147.speaker: Nettie
147.text: Well, not to worry. Have a read of that book - Flora of the Dalelands. There's a recipe for your antidote in there.
147.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

198.speaker: Nettie
198.text: It won't cure what's in your head, though.
198.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

258.text: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.
258.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

247.speaker: Nettie
247.text: Master Halsin and I were tracking them, studying them, trying to figure out what the hells was going on.
247.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

288.speaker: Nettie
288.text: Because you should all be changing - there should be a small army of mind flayers out there! But you're not. Weird powers aside, you seem perfectly normal.
288.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: What do you mean 'should' be changing?
269.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

316.speaker: Nettie
316.text: Mind flayers reproduce by infecting someone with their parasite. Seven gruesome days later, the victim transforms and a new mind flayer is born.

394.speaker: Nettie
394.text: The thing in your skull, though? It's different to anything in our records.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You must've learned something from studying them.
29.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

309.speaker: Nettie
309.text: For one, that thing in your head is like nothing we've ever seen from mind flayers.
309.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

415.speaker: Nettie
415.text: It's one of their worms, for sure, but this one gives you powers - telepathic connections. And it doesn't turn you into one of them.
415.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

308.speaker: Nettie
308.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: So you think it's only a matter of time?
76.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

203.speaker: Nettie
203.text: Could be, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.
203.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

50.speaker: Nettie
50.text: When Master Halsin heard the adventurers were heading that way, he saw a chance to get answers. Joined on the spot.
50.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

138.speaker: Nettie
138.text: Whatever he found there, he didn't make it back.
138.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

384.speaker: Player
384.text: What do you want me to do?
384.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

241.speaker: Nettie
241.text: The thing is, I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. None of us can even get close.

109.speaker: Player
109.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

289.speaker: Nettie
289.text: I've sent birds to find him, but the place is rotten with goblins. And if my birds can't get close, what chance do I have?

357.speaker: Player
357.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

162.speaker: Nettie
162.text: I think so. I hope so. I've sent birds to find him, but they can't get close without goblins trying to shoot them down.
162.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

146.speaker: Nettie
146.text: You, though? You're one of them - technically speaking, I mean. They won't kill someone carrying their parasite.
146.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

338.speaker: Nettie
338.text: If you can get Halsin out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?
338.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

235.speaker: Nettie
235.text: If you can find Halsin and get him out of there, we can discover what he learned. And perhaps he can save your life. How's that sound?
235.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I already know where to find him: the worg pens of the goblin camp.
11.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

275.speaker: Nettie
275.text: Gods above - why didn't you say so?
275.context: NodeContext: exasperated - they just wasted a lot of time.

18.speaker: Nettie
18.text: Please, you have to bring him back to us. For your own sake as much as ours.

306.speaker: Nettie
306.text: Thank you. It would mean everything to the grove. To me.

270.speaker: Nettie
270.text: I wish I could tell you what happened out there, but those adventurers were the only witnesses. And they're long gone.

164.speaker: Nettie
164.text: I wish I could tell you more, but only those adventurers know what happened out there.

318.speaker: Nettie
318.text: All I can say for sure is they all went to the old temple of Selûne and Master Halsin didn't make it back.

99.speaker: Nettie
99.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the oath you swore.

246.speaker: Nettie
246.text: Good luck out there. And if things start to go bad - remember the vial. Remember your oath.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: It sounds like you're making a lot of assumptions that could kill me.

47.speaker: Nettie
47.text: The way I see it, you have two options. Halsin or that wyvern poison.

64.speaker: Nettie
64.text: I don't envy your choice, truly. But this is the hand fate's dealt you.

343.speaker: Nettie
343.text: The way I see it, you have two options. Halsin or death - whatever form it takes.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: You're sure he can cure me?

107.speaker: Nettie
107.text: I can't make any promises. This is like nothing we've seen before.

215.speaker: Nettie
215.text: But I know this for sure: Master Halsin is the only one close to understanding these things. He's your best bet to survive.

412.speaker: Nettie
412.text: Otherwise, that vial's your only option.

421.speaker: Nettie
421.text: Otherwise you'll need to end things yourself, before the transformation really takes hold.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: That sounds like suicide. I won't do it.

139.speaker: Nettie
139.text: It might be suicide either way. Trust me, you do not want to become one of those monsters.

237.speaker: Nettie
237.text: But of course, the choice is yours. I just hope you find a cure out there.

361.speaker: Player
361.text: You said you were tracking other victims. Did they change?

413.speaker: Nettie
413.text: Hard to say, but there's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Excellent news! All the power, none of the tentacles.

229.speaker: Nettie
229.text: I wouldn't be so sure. There's a lot we don't know. Infected - folks like you - have been converging on an old temple of Selûne, and I've no idea why.

277.speaker: Player
277.text: Just tell me if there's a cure or not.

390.speaker: Nettie
390.text: You can't cure what you don't understand. And as much as I know about mind flayers, I can't make heads nor tails of this.

317.speaker: Nettie
317.text: I've spent my life treating folk and never once saw a mind flayer infection. Then suddenly there's dozens of you - maybe more.
317.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Drinks the AntidoteNodeContext: Reflecting on how weird all of this is

378.speaker: Player

83.speaker: Nettie
83.text: Then I'm sorry, but I can't. You're too dangerous.

194.speaker: Nettie
194.text: By rights your teeth should be falling out and your skin turning grey. I don't know why you haven't changed, but I can't risk you suddenly turning into a mind flayer.

263.speaker: Nettie
263.text: Do whatever you need to, but we're not leaving this room until it's over.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Fine - but better hope it works. Poison doesn't always hurt the pure of body.

106.text: Fine is not enough. Look at me.

355.text: Are you mad? I'm not going to kill myself - symptoms or not.

22.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

133.speaker: Nettie
133.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

221.speaker: Nettie
221.text: The door's locked. Neither of us are leaving until this is done.

429.speaker: Player
429.text: You said there were others like me - we need to cure this, or your kin will never be safe.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I'm the only one that can find Halsin.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: You said I have time - let me use it.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Magic can cure me if you can't. I know the Weave well!
